titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the New-York Historical Society Ephemera Collection
1800s-2021
PR 264
titlestmt.author: N-YHS staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:47:33 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is in English

physdesc.extent: (6 boxes, 2 albums, 1 drawer flat folders, and oversize flat)

did.abstract: The Ephemera Collection (formerly called the Ephemera File) contains a variety of print ephemera, such as advertisements, calendars, theatrical posters, political broadsides, event announcements, etc.
did.physloc: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ephemera Collection (formerly referred to as the Ephemera File) spans the period from approximately mid-19th century to the present, and contains a variety of printed ephemera, including advertisements, flyers, calendars, event announcements and programs, greeting cards, and other disposable or everyday items.

The collection is divided into 5 series. Series I, Ephemera, includes material relating to products (food, clothing, household items, etc.); establishments such as hotels and restaurants, charitable and other organizations; and cultural and political events, primarily in New York City.

Series II, Prohibition-related ephemera, includes speakeasy cards (advertising illicit bars that operated during the years of Prohibition), cartoons and caricatures, and other Prohibition and temperance related ephemera.

Series III, Advertising postcards, includes 510 postcards from the 1990s, which would have been found in bars, clubs, restaurants and other venues. The majority of these cards advertise New York businesses.

Series IV, Ephemera albums, consists of two albums of pasted-in ephemera, including scraps and diecuts, advertisements and trade cards. Notable items include images promoting racial and ethnic stereotypes and images of Santa Claus.

Series V, Erotic advertising cards, includes loose paper cards advertising phone sex hotlines, adult establishments and the like. This material is extremely graphic. Most of these were donated by photographer Andreas Feininger. N-YHS staff collected several others during the late 1980s and early 1990s.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Ephemera Collection was compiled by New-York Historical Society from various sources. 510 advertising postcards were donated by Bert Hansen in 2000. Erotic advertising cards were donated by photographer Andreas Feininger in the 1990's, and the Schreyer family in the early 2000's. The remaining items were acquired through staff or individual donations. It is anticipated that items will continue to be added.

accessrestrict.head: Access restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been organized into the following five series:

Series I: Ephemera
Series II: Prohibition-related ephemera
Series III: Advertising postcards
Series IV: Ephemera albums
Series V: Erotic advertising cards

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials at the New-York Historical Society
relatedmaterial.p: A more extensive collection of ephemera, primarily from the 19th century, can be found in The Bella C. Landauer Collection of Business and Advertising Ephemera, PR 31.
The Marilyn Gelfman Karp Collection of Ephemera, PR 279 includes ephemera from WWI and WWII as well as other 20th century ephemera.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: The collection is open for ongoing additions.

controlaccess.subject: Advertising -- United States.
Business enterprises -- New York (State) -- New York.
Clubs -- New York (State) -- New York.
Prohibition -- New York (State) -- New York.
Sex-oriented businesses -- New York (State) -- New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Ephemera, includes material relating to products (food, clothing, household items, etc.); establishments such as hotels and restaurants, charitable and other organizations; and cultural and political events, primarily in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes, among other documents, a dogwalker flyer with tear-off contact information; ticket to the Westminster Kennel Club Show at Madison Square Garden (1994); members pass for rides at the New York Zoological Society (1990); advertising picture postcard for Shar-Pei dogs; reprint of article "Horses in Old New York" by Benjamin Ladd Cook (autographed by Cook) (1961).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes, along other documents, business card for Baltimore County Stripper Inc (with price quote); name tag for the Ephemera Society of America conference; sales and show flyers and small pieces for Rhode Island Antiques Show (1988), a show in Pittsburgh Moose Lodge (1988), at the Greenwich (1988), "Modernism" at the Armory (1994); postcard for The Ross Group (poster sales); booklet for Manhattan Art and Antiques Center (1990s); flyer for antiques auction at Taylor and Taylor (1957).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The folder holds: one handbill for Romain-Barillier in Paris, card in French, undated, likely 1800s; remainder of items are gallery announcement cards from the 20th century: Kennedy & Company exhibition of "Little Old New York (circa 1940s); New York County exhibition announcement for "A Celebration of Three Hundred Years of Liberty" (1983); Linda Cummings (1997); Swann Photo Review Benefit Auction (1999), Photographic Literature & Photographs auction (2001), booksigning for Jay Maisel (2001); The Project and Salon 94 receptions (2007); Sepia reception for Vivan Sundaram, poster of "Trash" (2008); safe-T-Gallery reception for Anders Goldfarb (2008); and Higher Pictures opening for Scott Peterman ans Holly Hinman (2008).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holds items from the Museum of the City of New York (1983-84); Whitney (1984, 1991); Brooklyn Museum (2007); South Street Seaport map (circa 1983); Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum (2007-08); American Museum of Natural History Jumbo elephant exhibition (1993); Fraunces Tavern Museum (1983) and undated checklist of exhibition of paintings by John Ward Dunsmore; Museum of the Borough of Brooklyn at Brooklyn College (1984); 20th century art fair at Seventh Regiment Armory (1999).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder holds one item: Booklet "The richest man in Babylon tells his system" by George S. Clason, published by Financial Independence Founders Inc. (1930), gift of Mike Blumenthal, 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Bank for Savings and Mexico [NY] Motor Car Supply Co., with scenes from American history (1938-39); Pennsylvania Railroad, with artwork by Grit Teller (1949); The Blue Print Company, with images of blueprints for the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island renovations (1986); and Polygraphic Company of America, with art deco New York City themed image by Artzy Basheff (1936).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder holds four items: broadside for summer hats at Genin's of 507 Broadway, circa 1852 (gift, Stephen Manheimer, 2020); trade card for Hill Brothers milliners, featuring the "Myra" hat, 1885 (gift, 2017); trade card for Simon Weil, milliner, 19th century (gift, Pam Schafler, 2008); two receipted invoices from Knox hatter, 1907-08 (gift, Mrs. Max A. Polster, 2007).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder holds a small number of items related to the coronavirus pandemic and racial justice and other social protests from the same time period. These items were donated to N-YHS from various sources as part of the History Responds collecting initiative.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Invitation from the Wichita Club to a testimonial dinner at the Star Casino for Executive Member Nathan Burkan, with related menu (1916); Schulte Roth & Zabel, menu for New Partners' Dinner held at N-YHS (2007).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program from the annual Lincoln Dinner of the Republican Club.

did.unittitle: Dry goods/Department stores - grocery and feed stores

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes, among other documents, trade cards for Clark's O.N.T. spool cotton, Niagara starch, Hornby's grocer; a list of the Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company's (A&P) branches in the U.S. on reverse of a large decorative chromolithograph and letter press depicting a bird and nest in a basket (gift of Linda Ferber, 2017); Whole Foods (Bowery location) brochure [2007]; manuscript bills and statements from W.H.H. Ransom & Son (1899), Arm & Hammer baking soda (1907); East River Milling Co. (1892), Auburn Tobacco Co (1929); cash register receipt from Dagostino (1986)

did.unittitle: Dry Goods/Department Stores - clothing and fabric

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes, among other documents, trade cards for Medford Fancy Goods, Charles Cohen; holiday greeting card from Montgomery Ward; Talbot Clothing Co. contest (guessing state-by-state 1896 presidential election results) (gift of Leo Hershkowitz); Devlin & Co circular/price list (1857); various small pieces from B. Altman; James McCreery & Co private sale invitation (circa 1927?); brochures and small pieces (circa 1990s) for Bloomingdale's, Lord & Taylor, Nordstrom.

did.unittitle: Dry Goods/Department Stores -- Macy's (includes Thanksgiving Parade)

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: The folder holds the following items: 2 tickets to a Jenny Lind concert at Castle Garden on May 24, 1852 (Gift, Buffalo History Museum, 2020); admission ticket to the reception for Admiral Dewey in New York City on September 30, 1899; a sticker commemorating the 150th anniversary of the U.S. Constitution in 1937, distributed by Pep Boys (gift, 2008); the seating list for the 1948 Unification Dinner held at the Waldorf-Astoria; mailing by the Railway and Locomotive Historical Society, New York Chapter, regarding a commemoration of the centennials of the New York and Harlem Railroads at New-York Historical on February 16, 1945; an invitation to the 1972 dedication of the American Museum of Immigration on Liberty Island; and a booklet of songs, prayers and statements published by the Salesian Mission on the occasion of the 1976 American Bicentennial.

did.unittitle: Events (includes centennial and sesquicentennial celebrations and Old New York lectures by henry Collins Brown)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes transcript and audio recording on CD (recorded by Story Corps) of Alison Schmid, with 2 pamphlets (gift of Alison Schmid, 2007); packet of observation deck tickets and brochure, Windows on the World (restaurant) business cards, bill, matchbox, and World Trade Center Club publicity booklet (gift of Alicia Latzer 2007); "Bravest of the Brave" CD (gift of Jay Comella, 2007).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: includes "Mind map" of all the parties involved in the restoration of lower Manhattan after the World Trade Center attack on 9/1//2001.

did.unittitle: Events - Bicentennial of New York Stock Exchange

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sugar Daddy candy (Nabisco brand) advertisement in the form of a broadside "Sugar Daddy News" featuring tennis player Bobby Riggs and a large photo of Riggs with tennis player Rosie Casals, continuing the "war of the sexes" theme from the Riggs/Billie Jean King match. Gift, Harvey Spiller, 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holds one object: a framed photograph of a child with an advertising slogan for Kassowitz & Montesani, commission merchants of fruit and produce at 357 Washington Street, New York. The object also includes an embedded thermometer.

did.unittitle: Greeting cards and greeting card brochures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: includes a 1930 announcement of Winold Reiss's interior design work at the Hotel St. George.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Hotel Lexington's Hawaiian Room menu (1937), gift of Dorothy Barck, 1937; Romeo Salta, mailed as correspondence with commentary (1954); Peter Luger's foil covering for chocolates (1987); plastic tab used to indicate degree beef was cooked, medium rare in this sample (1988); Serendity 3 (1988); Great American Health Bar (1991); Lexington Avenue Grill (1991); Piatti Pronti menu (1991); Keen's Chophouse (1990s?); City Bakery (1994 Lemonade Festival); Bond 45 (2005), gift of Joshua Hamerman, 2019.

Undated: Copacabana (highlighting Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis in the Copa's revue); Leon & Eddie's; Pluck U napkin; Gage & Tollner tea bag tag; O'Farrell's; Palm Beach Bar at Billy Rose's Casa Manana, numbered song list for requests; Martino's; Hermitage Shoppe tea room; Artepasta; B.R Guest Restaurants (various); Jerry's; Bruno's; Mars 2112; Mom's Bagels; Official All Star Cafe; Sundance menu; Yorkville Common Pantry free meal ticket; Beanstalk; Plataforma; Lucy's napkin; Zimmerman's Hungaria souvenir photograph of 7 women at table; Turf Cafe souvenir photograph frame (no photo); Stork Club napkin; Rainbow Gourmet menu; Jewelers Restaurant & Cafe I menu; Gold Rush; Le Cafe menu; Frank's; Harley Davidson New York Cafe; Hard Rock Cafe; El Tunnel menu.

Business cards: Mustang Sally's; Good Diner; Hasak; Hummus Place (2007); La Tour; Planet Hollywood; Bobby Van's Steakhouse; Ruby Foo's; Goldfinger's, gift of Craig Klose 2007; Dallas BBQ; Figs; McDonough's Spa; Kaspars; Official All Star Cafe; Jerry's; British Open; Plataforma; Martino's; Triple Crown ale house.

did.unittitle: Household - House Furnishings - Crystal and China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes city parks and amusement parks (Steeplechase Park)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes political protests

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Contains political protest posters, including Help End Demonstrations, a 1968 poster advertising a march and rally for peace. Martin Luther King Jr. was scheduled to speak at the rally; his widow Coretta Scott King read the notes from his speech "Ten Commandments on Vietnam."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes campaing buttons for Dwight Eisnenhower, Adlai Stevenson, John F. Kennedy, Lyndon B. Johnson, Richard Nixon, George Mcgovern, Hubert Humphrey, George Wallace, Ronald Reagan, George Bush, and others. Also include buttons for local campaings and other political issues (impeachment, anti-Vietnam, etc.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder holds only 1 item: publicity pamphlet for Fourth Universalist Society in the City of New York (circa 2001).

did.unittitle: Seeds and plants (includes flowers and florists)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes Illustrated letterheads from New York City businesses and hotels; a graphic telegram; an 1895 mourning card; a 1911 wedding announcement and invitation, written partially in Hebrew.

did.unittitle: Streets and Avenues, New York City

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holds 1 item: a 6x3 inch cardboard calculator used to determine New York City cross streets in relation to avenue addresses. Published as marketing item by Business Week magazine. Gift of Pamela Bayless, 2022.

did.unittitle: Technology - Phonographs, Sound Recordings, Steam Driller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder holds one item: Booket "Smoke Rings from an editor's pipe," edited by Howard S. Neiman, reprinted columns from The Textile Colorist (1942), gift of Mike Blumenthal, 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes advertisement for newsreel movie about Nazi atrocities (film evidence used at Nuremberg Trials)

did.unittitle: Theatrical enterprises - Specs for "Hello Dolly" set (New York Streets drawn by Ron Hobbs)
Toilet articles and beauty aids - colognes and perfumes
Toilet articles and beauty aids - colognes and perfumes - sample cards
Toilet articles and beauty aids - face care - makeup
Toilet articles and beauty aids - hair care
Toilet articles and beauty aids - nail care
Toilet articles and beauty aids - spas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 invoices from Trinity Church Cemetery (1905) and 1 from Havender's Monumental Works (1919) for the Anness family (accession 2007.50); fan-shaped advertising cards for George L. Jones of 455 Lenox Ave, with drawing of flowers, and for David M. Jaudon Inc of 104 West 131st Street, with Christian/Bible-themed drawing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holds one item: list of tours in conjunction with exhibition "Jane Jacobs and the Future of New York" (2007)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes "Make and Mend for Victory" booklet with tips on conserving and recycling clothing; ration books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Prohibition-related ephemera, includes speakeasy cards (advertising illicit bars that operated during the years of Prohibition), cartoons and caricatures, and other Prohibition and temperance related ephemera.

did.unittitle: Disbound album of speakeasy cards and other prohibition-era ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III, Advertising postcards, includes 510 postcards from the 1990s, which would have been found in bars, clubs, restaurants and other venues. The majority of these cards advertise New York businesses. These were donated by Bert Hansen in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV, Ephemera albums, consists of three albums of pasted-in ephemera, including scraps and diecuts, advertisements and trade cards. Notable items include images promoting racial and ethnic stereotypes and images of Santa Claus.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: This album was a gift of Maureen Howard, 2010

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V, Erotic advertising cards, includes loose paper cards advertising phone sex hotlines, adult establishments and the like. This material is extremely graphic. Photographer Andreas Feininger donated most of the items in Box 9 and 9A, including a dis-bound scrapbook of erotic advertisements. N-YHS staff collected some additional advertisement during the late 1980s and early 1990s. The material in box 10 was donated by the Schreyer family.
